metadata.title: Update README with Frontend Setup Docs

story.iWant: comprehensive frontend development documentation in the README
story.soThat: I can quickly understand how to install, configure, and run the frontend for local development

tasks.task: Review current README frontend documentation 1.1: Analyze existing "Frontend Setup" section in README.md 1.2: Identify gaps between current docs and developer needs 1.3: Review frontend/package.json for all available scripts
Enhance prerequisites documentation 2.1: Document Node.js version requirement (18+) 2.2: Document npm version recommendation 2.3: Note optional tools (VS Code extensions, etc.)

Expand installation and development commands 3.1: Document complete npm install process 3.2: Document npm run dev and expected output 3.3: Document npm run build for production builds 3.4: Document npm run lint for code quality checks 3.5: Document npm run test commands for running tests
Complete environment variable documentation 4.1: Document NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL configuration 4.2: Document any other frontend environment variables 4.3: Provide example .env.local file content

Add troubleshooting section 5.1: Document common npm install errors and solutions 5.2: Document port conflicts resolution (3000 already in use) 5.3: Document API connection issues (CORS, backend not running) 5.4: Document Node.js version mismatch issues
Verify documentation accuracy 6.1: Follow documentation steps on fresh environment (if possible) 6.2: Verify all commands work as documented 6.3: Check for consistency with existing documentation

acceptanceCriteria.criterion: Prerequisites documented - Node.js version (18+), npm, and any other required tools
Installation commands - npm install and npm run dev commands clearly explained
Environment variable setup - NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL and any other required env vars documented
Common troubleshooting tips - Solutions for typical frontend setup issues

Use same formatting style as existing README sections
All commands must be verified to work correctly

interfaces.interface: dev: Start development server on port 3000 build: Create production build start: Start production server lint: Run ESLint checks test: Run Vitest in watch mode test:run: Run Vitest once test:coverage: Run tests with coverage report

tests.standards: This story is documentation-only and does not require automated tests. However, the documentation accuracy should be manually verified by following the documented steps.

ideas.idea: Verify Node.js 18+ requirement by testing with Node 18 LTS
Verify all npm commands work: npm install, npm run dev, npm run build, npm run lint, npm run test
Test troubleshooting steps for common issues
